data.title: Anniversary Special: 7 Films Which Have Abhishek Bachchan-Aishwarya Rai Bachchan Starring Together
data.meta_description: Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan who are most beloved Bollywood couples today celebrate 16th wed anniversary
data.text:
Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan are one of the most beloved couples in the Bollywood industry. Today, on April 20, Aishwarya and Abhishek celebrate their 16th year marriage anniversary.

Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Abhishek Bachchan were married in a private ceremony on April 20, 2007, at the Bachchan residence, Prateeksha, in Mumbai. On November 16, 2011, the couple welcomed their daughter, Aaradhya, into the world after four years of marriage.

The couple first met in 1999 during a photo shoot for Dhaai Akshar Prem Ke, as revealed by Abhishek. They have starred together in seven movies as well as Aishwarya made a special appearance in Bunty Aur Bubliâ€™s popular song Kajra re where she performed alongside Abhishek and Amitabh Bachchan.

Here are seven films in which Aish and Abhi starred together:

Dhaai Akshar Prem Ke (2000)

Kuch Naa Kaho (2003)

Dhoom 2 (2006)

Umaro Jaan (2006)

Guru (2007)

Sarkar Raj (2008)

Raavan (2010)

Dhaai Akshar Prem Ke (2000)

Dhaai Akshar Prem Ke is a romantic drama film starring Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan in lead roles. The film is directed by Raj Kanwar and produced by Ashok Ghai.

It revolves around Karan Khanna, an army officer and Sahiba, a young woman who had witnessed a brutal murder. She is rescued by Karan when she is assaulted at a train station. Eventually, she returns home and is accompanied by Karan. Her family thinks that Karan is her husband and for months they pretend as a married couple. Karan is in love with Nisha and wants to leave as soon as possible. L He eventually leaves to meet Nisha only to know that she is already married to someone else. As he moves on, he realises that he has fallen in love with Sahiba who is soon going to be married to Vicky.

Though the film did not do well at the box office, its soundtrack, composed by Jatin-Lalit, was much appreciated.

Kuch Naa Kaho (2003)

Kuch Naa Kaho is a romantic comedy-drama film that was directed by Rohan Sippy and produced by Ramesh Sippy. The movie starred Abhishek Bachchan, Aishwarya Rai and Arbaaz Khan in the lead roles, along with Satish Shah, Suhasini Mulay, and Jaspal Bhatti in supporting roles.

The story revolves around Raj, a young man who lives in America and is forced to get married by his uncle. His uncle assigns this task to Namrata, his secretary, who is asked to find a suitable bride for Raj. However, Raj soon falls for Namrata instead. As time passes Namrata too falls in love with him. Eventually, Raj learns that Namrata has a son and she was previously married to Sanjeev who left when she got pregnant. Her ex-husband arrives in America and begins to threaten her and Raj's relationship.

The film received mixed reviews from critics but was appreciated for its music, performances, and cinematography. The soundtrack of the film, composed by Shankar-Ehsaan-Loy, was a huge hit, with songs like Achchi Lagti Ho, Tumhe Aaj Maine Jo Dekha, and the title track Kuch Naa Kaho becoming very popular.

Dhoom 2 (2006)

Dhoom 2 is an action-thriller movie, directed by Sanjay Gadhvi and produced by Aditya Chopra. The movie stars Hrithik Roshan, Abhishek Bachchan, Aishwarya Rai, Bipasha Basu, and Uday Chopra in lead roles.

The story of the movie revolves around ACP Jai Dixit and his team, who are on a mission to catch a notorious thief named Mr A, who is known for his incredible skills in stealing valuable artifacts and his ability to evade the police. In his pursuit, Jai teams up with a beautiful thief named Sunehri, who has her own reasons for helping Jai catch Mr A.

It was a commercial success and received positive reviews for its action sequences, music, and cast performances. Additionally, its cinematography is visually appealing and stylish. Dhoom 2 became one of the highest-grossing Bollywood movies of all time.

Umaro Jaan (2006)

Umrao Jaan is a musical romantic drama film, directed and produced by J.P. Dutta. The movie is based on the life of the famous courtesan Umrao Jaan Ada. The movie is set in 19th-century Lucknow and revolves around the life of a young girl named Amiran, who is kidnapped and sold to a brothel. She is renamed Umrao Jaan and trained in classical music and dance. As she grows up, Umrao Jaan becomes one of the most sought-after courtesans in Lucknow and gains the attention of several wealthy and powerful men. However, despite her success, Umrao Jaan longs for a life of respectability and true love.

The movie stars Aishwarya Rai in the lead role of Umrao Jaan, with Abhishek Bachchan, Shabana Azmi, Sunil Shetty, and Divya Dutta in supporting roles. The movie received mixed reviews from critics and audiences alike, with some praising Aishwarya Rai's performance and the music.

Guru (2007)

Guru is a 2007 film, directed and co-written by Mani Ratnam and starring Mithun Chakraborty, Abhishek Bachchan, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Madhavan, Vidya Balan and Roshan Seth.

The story is set in the 1950s and 60s and follows the journey of Gurukant Desai (played by Abhishek Bachchan), a young man from a small village in Gujarat who dreams of becoming a successful businessman. Gurukant moves to Bombay (now Mumbai) to pursue his dreams and starts a small business selling fabric. With his ambition and business acumen, he soon becomes one of the biggest textile merchants in the city. Gurukant faces numerous challenges in his journey, including government regulations, business rivals, and personal relationships. He also has a complicated relationship with his wife, Sujata (played by Aishwarya Rai), who supports him but is also critical of his methods.

It features an acclaimed soundtrack composed by A. R. Rahman, with popular songs like Barso Re and Tere Bina. Guru received critical acclaim and was a commercial success.

Sarkar Raj (2008)

Sarkar Raj is a political thriller film, directed by Ram Gopal Varma. It stars Amitabh Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan, and Aishwarya Rai in lead roles.

The film is a sequel to the 2005 film Sarkar and continues the story of the powerful political figure Subhash Nagre, also known as Sarkar and his son Shankar.

In the sequel, the father-son duo faces new challenges and conspiracies as they try to set up a power plant in a rural area of Maharashtra, which is opposed by local politicians and industrialists. The movie explores themes of power, corruption, and morality in politics.

The movie received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising the performances of the cast, especially Amitabh Bachchan, and the gripping storyline. The movie was a commercial success and the performances of the cast were highly appreciated. Aishwarya Rai played the role of Anita, the CEO of a multinational corporation, and her performance was appreciated by the audience and critics alike.

Raavan (2010)

Released in 2010, Raavan is a modern retelling of the Indian epic Ramayana. The film is directed and co-produced by Mani Ratnam. The movie stars Abhishek Bachchan, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, and Vikram in the lead roles.

The movie revolves around a bandit named Beera Munda who kidnaps the wife of a police officer named Dev Pratap Sharma. The kidnapped wife, Ragini, develops a bond with Beera and begins to question her own values and morals as she spends time with him in the jungle. The movie explores themes of good and evil, love and redemption, and the consequences of violence.
